    • ggbivariate(): Plot an outcome with several potential explanatory variables
    • ggnostic(): Model diagnostics
    • ggscatmat(): Numeric pairwise plot matrix

ggmatrix gtable object

Source: R/ggmatrix_gtable.R
ggmatrix_gtable.Rd

Specialized method to print the ggmatrix object.

Usage

ggmatrix_gtable(
  pm,
  ...,
  progress = NULL,
  progress_format = formals(ggmatrix_progress)$format
)

Arguments

pm

ggmatrix object to be plotted

...

ignored

progress, progress_format

Please use the 'progress' parameter in your ggmatrix-like function. See ggmatrix_progress for a few examples.

Author

Barret Schloerke

Examples

data(tips)
pm <- ggpairs(tips, c(1, 3, 2), mapping = ggplot2::aes(color = sex))
ggmatrix_gtable(pm)
#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
